#Text=Store Cooked Food
#Text=Food preparation is somewhat a tough task .

#Text=There is always an element of challenge available the time of food preparation considering how advanced kitchen appliance you may have how proficient the cooking techniques may be , or how easy the recipe might be .
#Text=Moreover , the task is not after preparing the food because you have to store the food for the further meal .
#Text=There are many innovations available to store the foods , as an example Refrigerator .
#Text=Food storage processes have also gone through an evolution over the century .
#Text=With the invention of refrigerators , people can breathe a sigh of relief as they made it too easy to store any food easily inside them .
#Text=Moreover , deep freezers were also introduced primarily for bulk storage of food .
#Text=Ever thought about storing the food without a refrigerator ?
#Text=Do you now how to store cooked food properly .
#Text=Here you will come to know about storing the foods in many ways .
#Text=Well , every innovation that arrives on the market brings some new set of problems which are hard to deal .
#Text=Refrigeration and food storage also have some common issues where food turns deteriorate , or it no longer remains the same as new .
#Text=In the article , we are going to address you to some of the most common food storage problems .
#Text=We will also advise some tips and tricks focusing on frozen storage which will help you store the food for a longer period without losing the flavor of the food or rotting it .
#Text=Steps
#Text===
#Text=Wrap your Food
#Text===
#Text=Wrapping/Covering is one of the most proficient food storage techniques most widely used around the globe .
#Text=This method is suitable for travelers who cannot carry any other food storage with them .
#Text=The main thing while storing food is to preserve the moisture in the food without letting the air get to it .
#Text=By wrapping the food , you can hold the moisture in it and also the food will remain fresh for an extended period .
#Text=So , what material should you use wrap food ?
#Text=Well , there are many food wrappers available these days .
#Text=Aluminum foil is the best material to wrap and store food while traveling .
#Text=If you wish to store your food in freezers , the best options are freezer storage bags , plastic wraps and plastic coated freezer paper .
#Text===
#Text=Store Foods in Plastic Materials
#Text===
#Text=If you want to store foods for eating it later you have to use plastic box or bags .
#Text=When you are intending to store cooked foods like meat fish or desserts you should use plastic boxes and bags to wrap it over .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Freezing Cooked Poultry and Meat
#Text=Poultry and meat are the most troublesome ingredients to store .
#Text=Cooked meat contains more content of moisture than the raw meat , so it is important to preserve the moisture .
#Text=For storing cooked meat and poultry in a freezer , the best technique is to wrap the meat tightly in a plastic wrapper/aluminum foil or keep it in a plastic box .
#Text=Make sure to debone the meat and keep it in larger pieces before wrapping .
#Text=Also , you should ensure that the air cannot get into the food .
#Text=After wrapping , immediately store the food in zero degrees Fahrenheit .
#Text=Type of meat you should freeze :
#Text=You can freeze almost all kinds of meat .
#Text=People sometimes ask whether they can freeze tenderized meat or not .
#Text=As tenderizing comes into effect while cooking meat , it can be frozen .
#Text=However , you cannot store or freeze canned meat because
#Text=• Most canned foods have liquids inside them , and seals of the can prone to breakage while you freeze it . •
#Text=Canned items are covered with moisture .
#Text=Hence , the food inside a can is already stored , so there is no need to store a can full of foods .
#Text=You can keep it in a cool place , on your shelf or in the refrigerator in a normal cooling mode .
#Text=Freezing Time :
#Text=One common issue about storing the food is freezing time .
#Text=Well , there is no such limit regarding how long you should store/ freeze the foods in a refrigerator .
#Text=But due to dehydration , the food may lose somewhat its flavor .
#Text=Wrapping your foods well can keep the flavor of the foods for a long time .
#Text=If you wrap the food well it may remain fresh for years or two .
#Text=Nutrients
#Text=Preservation :
#Text=There is another primary objective of food storage and it is to preserve the nutrients of food .
#Text=Hence , food storage addresses to the requirement very well .
#Text=While you freeze the food , it does not lose the nutrients .
#Text=Sometimes , the food only loses the flavor .
#Text=However , the protein content of meat or poultry slightly reduces while freezing .
#Text=But it only occurs if you store it crossing the limited time of 9 months .
#Text=Storing Food In a pressure cooker :
#Text=Modern day pressure cookers are like hotpot .
#Text=After cooking your dish , you can also store it in a pressure cooker .
#Text=If you cook large dishes like a roast with vegetables , fish , meat dishes , and chicken , then you may want to store it overnight and have the leftovers the next day .
#Text=As the Best Electric Pressure Cooker can keep the food warm even after 5 hours of cooking
#Text=you can easily store the food in it .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Freezer Burns is the process where the surface of the food dries off in a while freezing .
#Text=In case you forget to cover your food before storing it in the freezer , there can be high chances of freezer burns to your food .
#Text=It makes food dehydrated , and the dehydrated spot is left dry , tasteless and affects the quality of food .
#Text=Freezer burns happen because insufficient covering allows the air to get to the food .
#Text=Leaked plastic bags are also responsible for freezer burn .
#Text=Freezer burns leave brownish gray spots on foods , and the food becomes dry .
#Text=However , it damages the food to an extent where the food no longer remains eatable .
